intro: Hallieracantha undulata, commonly known as the wavy-flowered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, undulating petals that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its small, tubular flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance. Hallieracantha undulata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its delicate appearance and resilience in arid conditions.
